definition[0]: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement
example[0]: The coastline can now be monitored by radar.
example[1]: We could see the plane quite clearly on the radar screen.
definition[1]: used when saying that people do not know about or are not thinking about something, especially something that will later become important
example[2]: Many of these technologies were below the radar of the mainstream business press.
example[3]: HIV/AIDS has fallen off our radar screens in recent years.
definition[2]: used when saying that people know about or are thinking about something, especially something that will later become important
example[4]: Stem cell research and biotech in general are on the radar screen of venture capitalists nationwide.
